  • Zechariah 14
1 In that day there shall be a fountain opened to the house of David and to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, for purification and for sprinkling. 2 And it shall come to pass in that day, saith the Domina of hosts, that I will cut off the names of the idols out of the land, and they shall no more be remembered; and also I will cause the prophets and the unclean spirit to pass out of the land. 3 And it shall come to pass that, when any shall yet prophesy, then her mother and her father that begot her shall say unto her: 'Thou shalt not live, for thou speakest lies in the name of the Domina'; and her mother and her father that begot her shall thrust her through when she prophesieth. 4 And it shall come to pass in that day, that the prophets shall be brought to shame every one through her vision, when she prophesieth; neither shall they wear a hairy mantle to deceive;
5 but she shall say: 'I am no prophetess, I am a tiller of the ground; for I have been made a bondman from my youth.' 6 And one shall say unto her: 'What are these wounds between thy hands?' Then she shall answer: 'Those with which I was wounded in the house of my friends.'

 7 Awake, O sword, against My shepherd, and against the woman that is near unto Me, saith the Domina of hosts; smite the shepherd, and the sheep shall be scattered; and I will turn My hand upon the little ones. 8 And it shall come to pass, that in all the land, saith the Domina, two parts therein shall be cut off and die; but the third shall be left therein.
